name: Crowne Plaza Dubai Festival City

reviews.title: Superb place to stay
reviews.text: the hotel sits on the Creek and shares it's pool with the co-joined Intercontinental Hotel. The hotel itself is closer to the airport (£8 each way) than city centre but thats all the better as the view of the city skyline over the creek at night is just spectacular.

reviews.title: FIRST CLASS
reviews.text: the staff are superb and the rooms are fantastic - can't fault anything!!

reviews.title: Quality and excellence are just some of their best qualities>
reviews.text: the hotel itself has a Belgian beer bar which serves good food, beer and has live entertainment 2-3 times per week.

reviews.title: Comfortable stay
reviews.text: The hotel is also attached to a shopping centre with approx 300 shops and restaurants.

reviews.title: Another fantastic stay at Festival City Crowne Plaza May 9th-15th
reviews.text: can't wait to go back!!

Simply incredible stay, was great to see Herman at the front desk to check us in! Loved every aspect of our stay from the check in experience, very comfortable and clean rooms, service was out of this world and the pool area just great for pure relaxation! Look out onto the Burj Khalifa as you swim! Absolutely love the adjacent mall - festival city! This hotel is a must stay!
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.text: This hotel is part of a complex that includes the Intercontinental Hotel. The restaurants and bars in each hotel can be used by guests from either, and charge to your room. Having stayed in both my choice is to stay in the Crowne Plaza because the design of the rooms are more to my taste, being very modern and the bathrooms are just fantastic. Meanwhile the choice of good quality restaurants in the Intercon is brilliant.
reviews.title: Great hotel for business or pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complex is attached to the enormous Festival City shopping mall so all is within airconditioned walking distance.
reviews.title: Great staff and pool area
Great Hotel with great staff
reviews.text: We stayed at Crown Plaza Hotel for 10 nights and we were pleased overall with our experience. At first we were placed in a room which smelled of damp and cigarette smoke (it is supposed to be a non-smoking hotel) but after we complained we were upgraded to a room on the other side of the hotel with a fantastic view over the city and Burj Khalifa (and no funny smells). We think they handled our complaint professionally and were very pleased with our new room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all extremely nice and helpful and the pool area was great with several pools and nicely designed area. The gym, sauna and steamroom were great too. We really enjoyed the breakfast buffe, although we found it a bit pricey.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in Dubai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Crowne Plaza has everything a long distance traveller could wish for. The rooms are generous and well appointed with comfortable beds & office desk arrangement. Block out curtains are generous and allow weary travellers a chance to rest well. A treat which I was impressed with is the "sleep" lavender products left on the pillow. Was a little sceptical but had 2 beaut nights sleep - usually don't sleep so well in strange beds. The hotel is an easy ride from the airport, love the location overlooking the creek with the very inviting pool/lounge area. Another huge benefit is the ease in which you can walk through the inter-connecting walkways through the Inter-Continental next door on your way to the Festival City Mall and variety of restaurants to enjoy overlooking the creek.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a break
Too easy!
reviews.text: Our experience at this hotel was a little varied, however, overall the attentive, welcoming & professional staff are no doubt this property's greatest asset.

Very close to airport and I arrived at 5am. Girls on front desk allowed me a very early check in to enable me to freshen up and have a sleep after a long flight. The room service, laundry service and in general all hotel staff are very welcoming and everything is too easy. Great little Beligan beer cafe in the lobby serving ice cold Stella Artois. Shopping next door and so is the Hard Rock cafe. Great view of the Dubai city skyline and the worlds tallest building on dusk. All in all this was a excellent stay and now my preferred choice when in the UAE.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel
Very Nice Hotel.....
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights for a business meeting. Close to airport. In the vicinity of a large mall. Room overlooking the water creek. Room with look through glass bathroom. Large bed and comfortable pillows. I have seen more luxurious rooms in Dubai. More than one swimming pool. Complete gardens with palm trees on the fifth floor is the most attracting scene. Breakfast is delicious. Large conference hall in the adjacent intercontinental.

Emailed hotel well in advance to request a corner room, a creek view and advise of a Birthday celebration. On arrival was given a middle room and advised a creek view would be an extra charge. Managed to change room to a corner room with no creek view. Rooms are very nice. Breakfast restaurant is nice and breakfast good. Could not see the nice evening view over the creek from my room at the back of the hotel so went to the hotel terrace to see the view one evening only to be told quite abruptly that the terrace is now closed and to go inside the hotel. This was at about 9-10pm which seemed very early and was disappointing. The hotel did not remember the birthday celebration that they had been emailed about in advance and this was also very disappointing. The customer service at reception for me let down the nice hotel.
reviews.title: My stay at the crowne plaza

reviews.text: I stayed with my family for 6 days on a leisure trip. Very clean hotel, great staff who are very helpful and friendly and courteous. The chef at ZAytoun restaurant was amazing. Upon realizing that we had young kids, he took his time to sit with the mother to craft a menu for the whole week. Talk about a chef who knows and understands his clients' needs.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We do appreciate and thank the entire team for making our trip to dubai most memorable. Will definately visit again.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel but location needs to sell itself a little better

reviews.text: This was our second stay at the hotel and as we were Elite Priority Club members and returning customers we were given a suite on the 15th floor. Overall this hotel was great, not too far from the airport without the aircraft noise.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Since we were using our Reward nights, we felt this and the adjoining Intercontinental stood out from all the other IHG hotels. The service was just excellent.
reviews.title: great hotel, great staff

reviews.text: Our only comment was the location. If this is your first time in Dubai and you are looking to explore the popular areas of Jumerah, Dubai Marina, Palm etc then this is out of the way. 15 to 20 minutes in good traffic by taxi. Also the closest Metro station is five minutes away by taxi.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Efficient, polite, pleasant staff, and very professional, which can be rare in Dubai. Located less than 10 minutes from the airport, the Hotel is conveniently connected to a shopping mall, which makes it a perfect place to stay for a short layover in Dubai.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: Without even asking for it (and without being charged), I was upgraded to a better room with a beautiful view of Burj Khalifa and the Creek. The room was huge, extremely clean, comfortable, and stylish. Overall, the perfect stay.
reviews.title: Modern, clean but not à great location
Exceptional service - a "must" place to stay in Dubai
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, very modern and yes 5 stars !! But location is not the best, ok à taxi to all the tourist places cost about 10 €..... So if you want à good value hotel this is ik.
I was thinking about doing a line by line review about room, pool, restaurant, food, drink, staff, etc., etc. - but I don't need to. Everything about this CP is great.
reviews.title: A great stopover with added holiday thrown in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just book - whether for a flight stopover, couple of days sunbathing or as a base for a week (as we did) it has everything down to a tee. The few words I will say are as follows:
reviews.title: All as good as expected .....

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights on business. Hotel is connected to an Intercontinental hotel, then connected to Festival City (connected = skywalk to keep you away from the heat) which is a huge shopping centre complete with fairground, Ikea, lots of shops, places to eat, bowling, cinema etc.
reviews.title: OK for business, excellent for leisure

reviews.text: The hotel sits in front of a creek, to see over the creek there is a surcharge of about £35/night. Business view is onto the motorway which isn't that exciting.
reviews.title: One of my favorite hotel

reviews.text: Hotel is fine, contains a buffet/a la carte restaurant (also serves breakfast), and a belgian sports bar.
reviews.title: Very Convenient and Children Friendly

reviews.text: Room is very nice with remote control lights, large desk, comfy bed and nice bathroom with bidet.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay here

reviews.text: Good points: Close to airport (about £3 exc. surcharge), 5 mins walk from the Festival Centre where there is plenty to do and eat, large rooms, hot water is fine, TV and DVD player, breakfast was OK (I paid £8/night extra via Expedia and was worth it) with cooked and cold selections. Also had outdoor pool, fitness centre.
reviews.title: Outstanding service!

reviews.text: Overall stars - 5 of 5, Platinum IHG members are recognized as they should be and this is by far 1 of the hotels that went to a further extend to make my stay better, even though I did not pay a cent (using 25,000 of my IHG points). Am very happy.
reviews.title: Best hotel of my trip

reviews.text: Hotel staff - 5 of 5
reviews.title: Good business hotel

reviews.text: Restaurant staff - did not use
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel--Great location
Can't Fault
reviews.text: Room service staff -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping staff - 5 of 5, turndown was well done. I called recep and ask them to convey my compliment to housekeeping
reviews.title: Another lovely Xmas holiday

reviews.text: Great Hotel, good location, BUT, the hotel porters are forever trying to push guests into "hotel taxis" (really a limousine service) rather than use the perfectly adequate local Dubai taxis. At 50% more expensive this is seriously taking advantage of the unprepared, to the point where one has to wonder about collusion between the porters and the private taxi operators.
reviews.title: Taxi Issues

reviews.text: Beware....
reviews.title: Without a doubt, the best value premium hotel in Dubai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Crowne Plaza Festival City on 5 occasions now in the last 8 months and the property has never failed to disappoint me. The staff are friendly and courteous, the facilities are top notch and the location cannot be beaten for access to shopping (Festival Center mall is attached), airport (5 minute drive) or any of the business areas (10-15 minute drive depending on traffic). The prices are also very reasonable compared to comparable properties in Dubai. This continues to be my top choice hotel when I visit Dubai.
reviews.title: Ace Hotel

reviews.text: PROS
reviews.title: Good location near Airport. Great location if on business.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Very close to the airport but not close enough to know you're close!
reviews.title: Five star service at four star hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good hotel for the price. Sort of isolated from the city center, but a large enclosed multi-storey shopping center is within the same complex -- lots of eateries to choose from. Not far from the airport. Only complaint - in-room internet access is not free.
reviews.title: Solid hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommended.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: We had a 3 night stay in this hotel which was very nice., The rooms are modern and bright with a huge window looking into the bathroom from the living area/bedroom. The rooms were clean and of a good size. Breakfast was included in our stay which was really nice also with plenty of choice of both healthy and unhealthy options! Service was also good.
reviews.title: Great hotel - outstanding service!

reviews.text: The exterior of the hotel around the pool was really trendy looking with sofa's, giant cushions and hammocks as well as very comfortable sun loungers. Bottles of water around the pool are quite expensive but there is a shopping centre next door to the hotel that sells them. The pool itself was clean and nice (ice cold hand towels were also brought around to guests). If your sunbed was wet the pool attendants did not hesitate to change the towels on the sunbed to make them fresh again. The sauna and steam room which is situated behind the gym area was really clean tidy and peacefull if you fancied 10 minutes chilling on your own.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself re location was brilliant for the airport but not so good if you were looking to go down to the harbour although a taxi was not too expensive. The hotel was located a short taxi ride away from both big malls and the cost of this taxi ride was around 30 dirhams. The taxi ride to the airport was also around 30 dirhams.
reviews.title: Many of the Hotels in Dubai could learn a lot from this one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: back in Dubai this year for a week in the sun and we didn't want to stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Back Again!!

reviews.text: £6 in a taxi from the Airport, shopping centre next door. Belgian Beer Cafe(BBC) has a superb choice of food and drinks.
reviews.title: Nice Location, Beautiful Rooms
Good option for quick getaway
reviews.text: Pool - pool staff brilliant and provided complimentary cold towels and fresh fruit daily.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gym - OK choice of equipment and always someone on hand to provide water and towels.
reviews.title: Felt like we stayed in the heart of festival city

reviews.text: Room - superb!! with fantastic view over the Creek and Dubai skyline - bed is really comfortable (with a pillow menu). Only comment would be that the room wasn't always serviced before 5pm - although was spotless afterwards.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Service, Brilliant Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Dubai for the weekend to celebrate my wife's birthday. From the minute we arrived the staff made her feel very special. The room over looking the Creek was superb. we could not thank the hotel staff enough for all their help and care during our brief stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and staff

reviews.text: We will definitely go back.
reviews.title: Liked It

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for one night. I reached hotel past mid night. Check in was smooth. I requested for late check out which was immediately accommodated by the lady at the reception counter.
reviews.title: “very nice Hotel for relax”

reviews.text: The hotel is 15 minutes drive from airport and a little out of the way. You have to use taxi to communte to and from hotel. There is no metro station near this hotel. However, there is a Mall besides hotel where you can go for shopping. There also is a grocery store aroud the corner.
reviews.title: very comfortable and clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please note that this is a non-smoking property. So you won't find any smoking rooms here. The room was spacious and very good. Bath room was good too.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, love the location

reviews.text: My husband and i wanted a place to shower and sleep after a 15hr haul with our 1 yr old baby. we are so happy that we chose Crowne Plaza Festival City!!
reviews.title: Perfect For Stopover

reviews.text: A friendly employee was there to greet us at the airport and we were chaffeured to the hotel immediately. On pulling up outside we were greeted by name and promptly shown to our room by another lovely member of staff.
reviews.title: Very good but footballers had priority

reviews.text: The package we reserved online included dinner and breakfast and the restaurant Zaytoun was superb, with extremely attentive staff. The food was wonderful with personal service from the chef.
reviews.title: Excellent Service and value for money

reviews.text: The room was elegant and just what we needed for respite. Our baby loved the rain shower and we all were blown away by the amazing city views our room had.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but treated like second class citizen because we were not famous or there on business

reviews.text: The thing that sells this place for me particularly tho, is the way each staff member treated our daughter. She was no inconvenience, even when at 4am in the morning we have come to the lobby to write this review because she cant sleep. The reception staff are happy and friendly and want to play with her...
reviews.title: Best Business Hotel in Dubai

aka: Crowne Plaza Dubai Festival City Hotel
description: Crowne Plaza Dubai Festival City is located on the banks of the Dubai Creek. The 5 star hotel features 316 rooms and suites, with leisure facilities including 25m outdoor lap pool, 3 spa pools, children s splash pool, and 24-hour gym. Two 18-hole championship golf courses located minutes away. The hotel is proud to be the first non-smoking Crowne Plaza with a no-smoking policy in all rooms and public areas, offering our guests a cleaner and healthier environment during their stay. All rooms and bathrooms offer fantastic views of the creek or city skyline, equipped with high speed internet access and 37 LCD tv. Directly joined to the 38,000sq ft Event Centre, Crowne Plaza Dubai Festival City is ideal for all business travelers. The hotel has three superb restaurants - Zaytoun ( Olive in Arabic) all-day dining, Mazar lobby lounge, and the authentic Belgian Beer CafÃ©, each with stunning city and creek views. The hotel is connected directly to the Festival Waterfront Centre, a luxury shopping centre with over 550 retail outlets, 90 restaurants and cafÃ©s, and 100 berth marina, perfect especially during the famous Dubai Shopping Festivals over summer and winter months. Dubai is known for many attractions, all within easy access of the hotel - the iconic Burj Al Arab, record breaking Burj Dubai, Ski Dubai, Wild Wadi Water Park, Mall of the Emirates or the beautiful Dubai beaches in Jumeirah or Mamzar.
